summary: The bill, titled the "Strengthening Efforts for Relief and Vital Incentives for Community Service and Engagement Act" (SERVICE Act), amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to improve the Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) program. Key provisions include modifications to qualifying payment criteria, including buyback options for missed payments, a reconsideration process for denied applications, and a new online portal with information for borrowers. The bill also addresses the treatment of independent contractors, defines full-time employment, and mandates a Government Accountability Office (GAO) study on data matching for the PSLF program. Furthermore, it amends loan forgiveness for teachers and addresses the treatment of deferment, forbearance, and consolidated loans.
